availability.p: This is an open access work licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International license.

interpGrp.interp: Changes in spelling or orthography. This includes any alterations to how words are written without affecting their meaning, such as standardizing spelling or correcting errors. Also includes adding or removing an alif as a marker of the accusative or at the end of a plural verb. Changes to the diacritics for a final ي or ى can be ignored. If the change affects the meaning or grammatical function of the word (such as the form of a verb), then it is more significant than an orthographic change and should not be in this category.

An addition, omission or substitution to a single minor word or part of a word. A minor word means a conjunction, pronoun, demonstrative pronoun (e.g. ذلك), pronominal suffix, definite article, preposition, interrogative particle (such as 'ما') or other particle (such as 'قد'). This includes the expansion or contraction of a word and changes to verb form, such as modifications in verb tense, form, or voice, including changes to person or number and transformations between participle and verb. If the root word is the same but the number changes, then it falls in this category. It can still be in this category if the change affects the meaning substantially, so long as it is only affecting the part of speech described here or it does not change the root of the word. If there are changes to multiple words between readings (even if they are minor), then it should not be in this category but it is under 'Multiple_Word_Changes'. If there are multiple minor changes to a single word, then it can still be a Single_Minor_Word_Change.

An addition, omission or substitution to a single word that is more significant than a conjunction, pronoun, pronominal suffix, definite article, preposition, or particle (such as 'قد'). It is only a major word change if the root of the word is different. If a word is changed to a different form of the same root, then it is a Single_Minor_Word_Change. If the two readings are identical except for a difference in a single major word, then it is in this category (even if the readings otherwise contain multiple words).

Changes across more than one word. Words can be major or minor. Even if the changes are minor, if multiple words are changed, then it falls in this category. If more than one word is added or omitted, then it is in this category.

app.rdg: قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود
قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود
قال الرب لليهود الذين اتوا اليه

relation.desc: Several words are added.
More than one word is changed because by transposing اليهود it also affects the ل preposition.

This is because multiple words are being added where there was previously no text (OMIT). The addition includes several words (قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود) rather than just a single word. This matches similar examples provided, such as "OMIT → قال الرب لليهود الذين اتوا اليه" which was classified as Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. OMIT ➞ قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود

This is because multiple words are being added where there was previously no text (OMIT). The added text consists of several words including قال, الرب, للذين, اتو, اليه, and من اليهود. This matches examples like "OMIT → قال الرب لليهود الذين اتوا اليه" in the Multiple_Word_Changes category where several words are added at once.
c.f. OMIT ➞ قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود

The only difference between these readings is the omission of the final alif in اتوا/اتو, which is a purely orthographic variation that doesn't affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word. This matches similar examples provided like "قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود → قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود".
c.f. قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود ➞ قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود
Several words are added.

This is because multiple words (فكلمهم, ايضا, and يسوع) are being omitted. According to the definition, if more than one word is added or omitted, then it falls into the Multiple_Word_Changes category. This is similar to examples like "فقال لهم → OMIT" where multiple words are omitted.
c.f. فكلمهم ايضا يسوع ➞ OMIT
A single major word is added.
Two words are added.

The change involves adding the major word صوته while retaining وقال. Since this affects more than one word (by adding a new word), it falls under Multiple_Word_Changes rather than Single_Major_Word_Change. This is similar to examples like "فقال → اجاب يسوع وقال" where multiple words are added to the text.
c.f. وقال ➞ صوته وقال
The pronoun هو is added which is a minor word.

The preposition الي is omitted, which counts as a single minor word change since prepositions are considered minor words according to the category definitions. While there is also an orthographic change in في/فى, changes to the final ي/ى are to be ignored according to the orthography category definition.
c.f. يمشي في الظلمه الي ➞ يمشي فى الظلمه
The preposition (with pronominal suffix) معه is changed to له.
The preposition ل is added to الدهر.

This variation involves two distinct changes: (1) the word الابد is changed to الدهر, which is a major word change, and (2) the preposition with pronominal suffix معه is changed to له, which is a minor word change. Since there are changes to multiple words (even though one is minor), this must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definitions provided.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل تكون له

This variation involves multiple changes: (1) الابد is changed to الدهر which is a major word change, and (2) معه is changed to له which is a change in preposition with suffix. Even though one change is major and one is minor, because there are changes to multiple words, this falls under Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definition.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل يكون له

The word الابد is changed to الدهر. Both words are major words (nouns meaning "eternity/forever") with different roots, and this is the only change between the readings. This matches examples like بيت الكنز → بيت القربان where one major word (noun) is substituted for another.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل تكون معه

This is because there are two distinct changes: (1) الابد is changed to للدهر which is a change in the major word, and (2) معه is changed to له which is a change in the preposition with pronominal suffix. Since there are changes to more than one word, this must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes, even though one of the changes is minor.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

The change involves modifying the verb form from تكون to يكون, which is a change in person (from 2nd to 3rd person). According to the category definitions, changes to verb form, including modifications in person, are classified as Single_Minor_Word_Change as long as the root remains the same. Here, the root ك-و-ن remains unchanged.
c.f. الدهر بل تكون له ➞ الدهر بل يكون له

This variation involves two distinct changes: (1) the verb form changes from يكون to تكون, and (2) the preposition with pronominal suffix changes from له to معه. Since there are changes to multiple words, even though they are relatively minor changes, this must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definition provided.
c.f. الدهر بل يكون له ➞ الدهر بل تكون معه

This is because there are two distinct changes: (1) الدهر is changed to للدهر by adding the preposition ل, and (2) the verb form is changed from يكون to تكون. Even though both changes might be considered minor individually, when multiple words are changed (even if the changes are minor), it falls under the Multiple_Word_Changes category according to the definition provided.
c.f. الدهر بل يكون له ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

The justification is that there are two distinct changes: (1) the addition of the preposition ل to الدهر, and (2) the change from معه to له. Even though both changes involve minor words (prepositions and pronominal suffixes), because there are changes to multiple words, this must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definitions provided.
c.f. الدهر بل تكون معه ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

The word نور is added, which is a major word (noun) rather than a minor word like a conjunction, pronoun, or particle. Since this involves the addition of a single major word while the rest of the reading remains identical, it falls under the Single_Major_Word_Change category, similar to examples like "وهو فى → وهو في الحق" where a single major word is added.
c.f. الحياه ➞ نور الحياه

The word الي is a preposition, which falls under the category of minor words as defined in the guidelines. The change involves adding a single minor word where there was previously nothing (OMIT). This is similar to other examples in the Single_Minor_Word_Change category where prepositions are added or changed, such as the example where له is changed to معه.
c.f. OMIT ➞ الي
The pronoun انت is added and an alif is added to تشهد.
A ب preposition is add to حق.
The orthographic change is made to يسوع making it ايسوع and the ف conjunction is changed to a و.
The conjunction ف is changed to و.
The spelling of يسوع is changed to ايسوع.
The verb اجاب is added and the phrase فقال لهم is moved to the end. The conjunction ف is changed to a و.

This is because multiple changes occur: the word اجاب is omitted, يسوع is changed to ايسوع (even though this is just an orthographic change), and the words are reordered. When multiple words are affected by changes, even if some changes are minor, it falls under Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definition and examples provided.
c.f. اجاب يسوع فقال لهم ➞ فقال لهم ايسوع

The only difference between these readings is the spelling of يسوع/ايسوع, where an initial alif is removed. This is a purely orthographic variation that doesn't affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word. This exact variation appears multiple times in the examples provided under the Orthography category (e.g. "اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم → اجاب يسوع فقال لهم").
c.f. اجاب ايسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب يسوع وقال لهم

The conjunction و is changed to ف, which is a change to a single minor word (conjunction). According to the definition, changes to conjunctions are considered Single_Minor_Word_Change if they only affect one word, which is the case here.
c.f. اجاب ايسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم

The change involves multiple words being modified: the verb فقال is replaced with اجاب, and the word order is rearranged. This matches similar examples in the Multiple_Word_Changes category, such as "فقال → اجاب يسوع وقال" where multiple words are added or changed.
c.f. فقال لهم ايسوع ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم

This is because there are two distinct changes: (1) يسوع is changed to ايسوع which is an orthographic change, and (2) the conjunction و is changed to ف. Since there are changes to more than one word, even though they are both minor changes, this must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definition.
c.f. اجاب يسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم
The conjunction و is added.
The preposition هي is added.

app.rdg: من اين انا والى اين انطلق فاما انتم
من اين انا والي اين اذهب واما انتم
اين اتيت ولا الى اين انطلق
اين اتيت ولا الي اين اذهب

relation.desc: Multiple words are changed.

This is because two minor words are changed: the conjunction و is omitted from the start and the particle انما is omitted. Since more than one word is affected by the change (even though they are both minor words), this falls under Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definition.
c.f. وانتم انما ➞ انتم
The major word تقظون is omitted.

This is because two words (ايما and تقضون) are being omitted. According to the definition, if more than one word is added or omitted, then it falls into the Multiple_Word_Changes category. This matches examples like "فقال لهم → OMIT" where multiple words are omitted.
c.f. ايما تقضون ➞ OMIT
The pronoun انتم is added.

This is a case where a single major word (تقضوا) is added where there was previously nothing (OMIT). Since تقضوا is a verb and not a minor word like a conjunction, pronoun, or particle, it qualifies as a major word change. This is similar to examples like "OMIT → شيطان" and "OMIT → باثامكم" where a single major word is added.
c.f. OMIT ➞ تقضوا
The conjunction و is added.

The change involves both the removal of اما and the addition of و, affecting two words. Even though both are minor words (اما is a particle and و is a conjunction), when multiple words are changed, added, or removed, it must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definitions provided.
c.f. اما انا ➞ وانا

The particle اما is omitted while keeping the conjunction و and the pronoun انا. Since this involves the omission of a single minor word (the particle اما), it falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change according to the definition and examples provided.
c.f. واما انا ➞ وانا
An alif of nasb is added to احد.
Two changes occur. The conjunction ف is added at the start and the orthographic change occurs by addings an alif of nasb to احد.
Diacritics are added.
The conjunction ف is added at the start.

This is because there are two distinct changes: (1) the addition of the conjunction ف at the beginning, and (2) the addition of an alif of nasb to احد. Since there are changes to more than one word (even though they are both minor changes), this falls under Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definition and examples provided.
c.f. ليس ادين احد ➞ فليس ادين احدا

The conjunction ف is added at the start of the phrase. This is a single minor word change because it only involves the addition of a conjunction, which is classified as a minor word. This matches similar examples provided such as "ليس ادين احدا → فليس ادين احدًا" where the conjunction ف is added at the start.
c.f. ليس ادين احد ➞ فليس ادين احد

The justification is that the only change is the addition of the conjunction ف at the start of the phrase. Since this is a change to a single minor word (adding a conjunction), it falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change. This matches the example provided: "ليس ادين احدا → فليس ادين احدًا [The conjunction ف is added at the start.]"
c.f. ليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احدا

This is because there are two distinct changes: (1) the addition of the conjunction ف at the beginning, and (2) the removal of the alif of nasb from احدا. While the removal of the alif of nasb would normally be an orthographic change, and the addition of ف would normally be a Single_Minor_Word_Change, when both occur together it must be categorized as Multiple_Word_Changes since more than one word is affected.
c.f. ليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احد

The justification is that this is simply the removal of the alif of nasb (accusative marker) from احدا. The examples provided show that changes involving the addition or removal of an alif of nasb are considered orthographic changes, as seen in examples like "ليس ادين احد → ليس ادين احدا" and "تكونوا احرارا → تكونوا احرار". This type of change does not affect the meaning of the word.
c.f. فليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احد

The justification is that this is simply the removal of the alif of nasb (alif al-tanwin) from احدًا. Changes involving the addition or removal of an alif as a marker of the accusative case are explicitly mentioned as orthographic changes in the category description. This is similar to the example "ليس ادين احدا → ليس ادين احد" provided in the Orthography category.
c.f. فليس ادين احدًا ➞ فليس ادين احد

This is because the change involves two distinct modifications: the addition of the pronoun هو and the removal of the pronominal suffix ي from لان. Even though both changes involve minor words (a pronoun and a pronominal suffix), the fact that multiple words are affected means it must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes according to the guidelines.
c.f. لاني ➞ هو لان
Changes occur to two words.
The form of لست is changed to ليست.
The form of ليست is changed to ليس.

The change from لست to ليس is a modification in the form of the negative particle. This is similar to the example "ليست واحدى → ليس وحدي" provided in the Single_Minor_Word_Change category. It involves changing the form of a single minor word without changing its basic function or root meaning.
c.f. لست وحدي ➞ ليس وحدي

This is a change in the form of the verb ليست to ليس, which is similar to the example "ليست واحدى → ليس وحدي" provided in the Single_Minor_Word_Change category. Changes to verb form are explicitly included in this category, and since it only affects one word and involves a grammatical modification rather than a change in the root, it qualifies as a Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. ليست وحدي ➞ ليس وحدي
The pronoun انا is added.
A pronominal suffix is added.
A و conjunction is omitted and pronominal suffix is added to a single word.

The change involves removing the conjunction و and modifying the spelling of the pronominal suffix. Since this affects a single word and only involves a conjunction (which is classified as a minor word), this falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change according to the definitions provided.
c.f. ولكني ➞ لكنى
Multiple words are added.
Multiple words are omitted.
Two words are added.

The word حق is a major word (noun) being omitted. This fits the pattern of other examples in the Single_Major_Word_Change category where a single major word is omitted, such as "تقدروا → OMIT" and "اشهد → OMIT".
c.f. حق ➞ OMIT

The justification is that هي is a pronoun, which falls under the category of minor words. Only one minor word (the pronoun) is being added to the text, similar to the example "الحق والحق → الحق والحق هو" where a pronoun was added.
c.f. حق ➞ حق هي
The pronoun انا is omitted.
The pronoun (with conjunction) وانا is omitted.

This is because the only change is the addition of the conjunction و at the start of the word انا. The conjunction و is considered a minor word according to the category definitions, and there is only one change being made.
c.f. انا ➞ وانا
The major word اشهد is omitted.
The preposition علي is omitted.

The word نفسى is a major word (noun with pronominal suffix) being omitted. This fits the pattern of other examples where a single major word is omitted, such as "تقدروا → OMIT" and "اشهد → OMIT". Since only one major word is affected, and it is being completely omitted rather than just having a minor change to its form, this falls under Single_Major_Word_Change rather than Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. نفسى ➞ OMIT

The change involves replacing the preposition على with the preposition ل (with pronominal suffix ي). Since this only affects a single preposition (which is classified as a minor word), and the demonstrative pronoun ذلك remains unchanged, this falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change. This is similar to examples like الدهر بل تكون له → الدهر بل تكون معه where one preposition with a pronominal suffix is changed to another.
c.f. على ذلك ➞ لي ذلك

This variation involves changes to multiple words: the preposition على is changed to لي, and the demonstrative pronoun ذلك is changed to وهو (which consists of the conjunction و and the pronoun هو). Since more than one word is changed, even though they are minor words, this falls under Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definition.
c.f. على ذلك ➞ لي وهو

The change involves two minor words: the demonstrative pronoun ذلك is changed to the conjunction و with the pronoun هو. Since this affects multiple words (even though they are both minor words), it must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definition and examples provided.
c.f. لي ذلك ➞ لي وهو

This is an orthographic variant because it only involves adding an initial alif to the spelling of يسوع without changing the meaning or grammatical function of the word. This is similar to the examples provided where يسوع/ايسوع variations are consistently categorized as orthographic changes.
c.f. يسوع ➞ ايسوع
Two words are omitted.
Two words are omitted.
The conjunction ف is changed to و, which is a change to a single minor word (conjunction). This is similar to the example "فقالوا → وقالوا" provided in the Single_Minor_Word_Change category.
c.f. فقال لهم ➞ وقال لهم
The preposition ب is added to هذا.

The auxiliary verb كان is omitted, which constitutes the removal of a single major word. While كان affects the meaning of the verbal phrase, changing it from "he was speaking to them" to "he spoke to them", it involves only one word being removed.
c.f. كان يكلمهم ➞ كلمهم
The noun الكنز is changed to القربان.
The conjunction ف is changed to و.
An alif of nasb is added to احد.
Two words are changed.
The article ال is added.
Two words are changed.

The change involves removing the pronominal suffix ه from ساعته, making it just ساعه. Since this is a modification to a single word that only affects a pronominal suffix, it falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change according to the definition. This is similar to other examples where pronominal suffixes are modified, added, or removed.
c.f. لان ساعته لم ➞ لان ساعه لم

The change involves replacing the pronominal suffix ه in ساعته with the definite article ال in الساعه. Since this is a change involving a pronominal suffix, which is classified as a minor word change according to the definitions, and it only affects a single word, this falls under the Single_Minor_Word_Change category.
c.f. لان ساعته لم ➞ لان الساعه لم

This is because there are changes to more than one word: لان is changed to اذ, and ساعه is changed to كانت. When multiple words are changed, even if they are minor changes, it falls into the Multiple_Word_Changes category. This matches the example "لان ساعته لم → اذ كانت لم" provided in the Multiple_Word_Changes examples.
c.f. لان ساعه لم ➞ اذ كانت لم
Two words are changed.
The word بلغت is changed to اتت.
The verb اتت is changed to اقتربت.
c.f. تكون اقتربت ➞ تكن اتت

This variation involves two distinct changes: (1) the verb form changes from تكن to تكون, which is a minor word change affecting the form of the verb, and (2) بلغت is changed to اقتربت, which is a major word change as it involves a different root. Since there are changes to multiple words (even though one is minor and one is major), this falls under Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definition.
c.f. تكن بلغت ➞ تكون اقتربت

The change involves modifying the form of the verb تكون to تكن. This is a change in the form of a single verb without changing its root, which falls under the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change as it involves "changes to verb form, such as modifications in verb tense, form, or voice." The root meaning remains the same, and only one word is affected.
c.f. تكون اتت ➞ تكن اتت

The verb اقتربت is changed to اتت, which involves a change in the root word (قرب to اتي). While there is also a minor change in the form of تكون to تكن, when a major word change occurs along with minor changes to the same word or other words in the reading, it still falls under Single_Major_Word_Change according to the definition. This is similar to the example "تكن بلغت → تكن اتت" provided in the Single_Major_Word_Change category.

app.rdg: قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود
قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود

relation.desc: Multiple wrds are added.
The final alif in اتوا is omitted.
Multiple wrds are added.
Two words are omitted.

This is because there are changes to multiple words: اذهب is changed to انطلق (different root), وتطلبوني has a change in orthography (ي to ى), and وفي is changed to ولا (different preposition/particle). Since more than one word is affected by these changes, even though some changes are minor, it must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. اذهب وتطلبوني وفي ➞ انطلق وتطلبونى ولا

The change involves the removal of a single conjunction و and the preposition ب which are both minor words according to the category definitions. Since this affects only one word (even though two minor elements are changed), it falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change rather than Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. وبخطاياكم ➞ خطاياكم

This is because there are changes to more than one word: خطاياكم is replaced with two different words (تجدونى and وباثمكم). Any time multiple words are changed, added, or removed, it falls into the Multiple_Word_Changes category, regardless of whether the changes are major or minor.
c.f. خطاياكم ➞ تجدونى وباثمكم

The change involves modifying the form of the verb تموتون to تموتوا, which is a change in the verb form without changing its root. According to the category definitions, changes to verb form (including modifications in tense, form, voice, person, or number) are classified as Single_Minor_Word_Changes as long as the root remains the same.
c.f. تموتون وحيث ➞ تموتوا وحيث
The pronoun (with conjunction) فانتم is added.

The verb انطلق is changed to اذهب, which involves a change in the root of the word. Since this affects only one word and changes its root, it qualifies as a Single_Major_Word_Change. The pronoun انا remains unchanged.
c.f. انطلق انا ➞ اذهب انا

The justification is that while there is a change from اذهب to انطلق (which are synonymous verbs meaning "to go"), and the addition of فانتم, this falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change because فانتم is a pronoun with a conjunction, which counts as a minor word according to the definition. The presence of انا in both readings shows that this is essentially adding a minor word (فانتم) to the phrase. This matches the example given: "انطلق انا → انطلق انا فانتم [The pronoun (with conjunction) فانتم is added.]"
c.f. اذهب انا ➞ انطلق انا فانتم
The form of تاتون is changed to تاتوا.

This is Multiple_Word_Changes because there are changes to more than one word: ليس is changed to لا (both negative particles but different words), and تاتون is changed to تجون (different root verb). Even though تقدرون remains the same, having changes to two different words puts this in the Multiple_Word_Changes category according to the definition.
c.f. ليس تقدرون تاتون ➞ لا تقدرون تجون

The change involves modifying the form of the verb تقدرو to تقدرون. This is a change in the verb form without changing the root of the word, which falls under the Single_Minor_Word_Change category according to the definition. Similar examples include "تقدروا → تقدرون" in the provided examples.
c.f. ليس تقدرو تاتوا ➞ ليس تقدرون تاتوا

This is Multiple_Word_Changes because there are changes to more than one word: ليس is changed to لا (a change in the negative particle), and تاتوا is changed to تجون (a change in the verb with a different root). This is because multiple words are added to the text (اجاب and ايسوع). This matches examples like "فقال → اجاب يسوع وقال" in the Multiple_Word_Changes category, where multiple words are added to a simple فقال.
c.f. فقال ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال
The preposition (with suffix) لهم is added.
The conjunction ف is added at the start and the major word شيطان is omitted.

The change involves replacing the minor word اما with the minor word ان, and there is an orthographic variation in في/فى which is not counted. Since this only involves changing one minor word (a particle), it falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change according to the definitions provided.
c.f. اما شيطان فليس في ➞ ان شيطان ليس فى

The only difference between these readings is the addition of the definite article ال to شيطان. According to the category definitions, changes involving the definite article are classified as Single_Minor_Word_Change, as the definite article is explicitly listed as a minor word. The root word remains the same, and only one word is affected by the change.
c.f. اما شيطان فليس في ➞ اما الشيطان فليس فيᐥᐥ

The preposition في is omitted, which counts as a minor word change since prepositions are explicitly listed as minor words in the category definition. Since only one minor word is affected, this falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change rather than Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. اما شيطان فليس في ➞ اما شيطان فليس

This is because there are changes to more than one word: ان is changed to اما, and في is omitted, while ليس has the conjunction ف added to it. Even though these are relatively minor changes, the fact that multiple words are affected means it must be classified as Multiple_Word_Changes rather than Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. ان شيطان ليس فى ➞ اما شيطان فليس

This is because there are changes to more than one word: the conjunction ف at the start is omitted, and the pronoun انا is replaced with the major word الشيطان. Even though one change is minor (removing ف) and one is major (changing انا to الشيطان), because multiple words are affected, this must be categorized as Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. فاما انا فليس في ➞ اما الشيطان فليس فيᐥᐥ

This is because there are two distinct changes: (1) the definite article ال is removed from الشيطان, and (2) the preposition في is omitted. Since there are changes to more than one word (even though one is a minor change involving the definite article), this falls under Multiple_Word_Changes according to the definition provided.
c.f. اما الشيطان فليس فيᐥᐥ ➞ اما شيطان فليس
The major word شيطان is added.
The major word التمس is omitted.

The change involves a single verb where the root is different (ل-م-س versus ط-ل-ب). Since this changes the root of the word and is not just a change in form/tense/voice of the same root, it qualifies as a major word change. This is similar to examples like يعتقكم → ايعرفكم where the root of the verb changes.
c.f. التمس ➞ اطلب

The verb اطلب is a major word (not a conjunction, pronoun, article, preposition, or particle) that is being omitted. This is similar to examples like "تقدروا → OMIT" and "اشهد → OMIT" where a single major word is omitted.
c.f. اطلب ➞ OMIT
The preposition هو was added.

The change involves the omission of the pronoun هو, which is a minor word according to the category definitions. Even though there is also an orthographic variation in الذي/الذى, changes to the diacritics for a final ي or ى can be ignored according to the definition of orthographic changes. Therefore, this is classified as a Single_Minor_Word_Change since it only involves the omission of one minor word (the pronoun هو).
c.f. هو الذي ➞ الذى

This is a transposition of two words (هو and الذي), which affects their order. According to the definitions, when multiple words are affected by a change (even through transposition), it falls under Multiple_Word_Changes. This is similar to examples like "قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود → قال الرب لليهود الذين اتوا اليه" where word order changes affect multiple words.
c.f. هو الذي ➞ الذي هو

This is because ان is a minor word (a particle) that is being omitted. The examples show that the omission of a single minor word like ان falls under Single_Minor_Word_Change, as demonstrated in the example "ان → OMIT".
c.f. ان ➞ OMIT

The change involves substituting one major word (الابد) with another major word (الدهر) while keeping the preposition الى unchanged. Since these words have different roots and are both nouns with significant meaning (not particles, pronouns, or other minor words), this qualifies as a Single_Major_Word_Change. This is similar to other examples in this category where one major word is substituted for another, such as "بيت الكنز → بيت القربان".
c.f. الى الابد ➞ الى الدهر
